resources.string: As a student, fight to protect the ocean or stop climate change by deeply engaging your government. We’ll show you how. As a teacher, we have rich and expanding resources. As a parent or individual, you can empower the kids.
This app was designed with a single purpose: to give youth a powerful voice to protect our world’s environment. It is no ordinary app.
Visit the app often to track our progress and get Action Alerts. Watch a growing army of determined kids change the world.
Get started on a letter-writing campaign, we\'ll show you how!
We have lots of learning material available to help you engage your students.
We need your support and donations. Learn how you can engage with Fatechanger.
Error! Unable to play youtube video!
Donations are tax-deductible and 100% of proceeds go to support saving the ocean.
Here are some examples of letters that students have written.
Look up who is the best person to write to in your country.
Write And Get The World Out
Who do I write a letter to?
To tell my government how I feel
Write a letter and spread the word.
Write your letter. Stamp, mail it, and enter it in the tracker through the map. And invite friends and family to join this very, very real battle. We can raise an army.

1) Only if your parents say it’s okay
2) Only if it’s legal in your country
3) Always and only peacefully
4) Communicate a clear message and demands
5) Use personal stories to get your message across
6) Make signs, borrow a bullhorn
7) 3 weeks before: notify other schools, environmental groups and kidssaveocean.com
8) 3 days before: notify the press and remind others
 9) If there’s any trouble, leave immediately
10) Stand up for what you believe in. Though you may be shy, have steel determination
Grownups have trouble changing. If you deeply feel the world must change faster to save the ocean and its creatures, multiply your activist impact by protesting.
TASK: Write your government a letter about plastic
TASK: Write your government a letter about climate
TASK: Start a letter writing campaign
TASK: Help create new environmental laws
TASK: Take part in or organize a protest
Start a letter-writing campaign with help from your classmates and teacher to fight plastic and climate emergencies. How many letters can your school write?
Be a leader. Cause a wave.

Local governments are usually very open to policy input from youth - especially when it’s well thought out, based on successful programs of other governments, and provides good publicity. If your government won’t engage in dialogue, grab a different tool: consider protesting.
Help your city or county develop policy
I plan to join the environmental policy hijack!
Enter a Letter in the Tracker
Written a letter, stamped, and mailed it off? You’re awesome. You’ve got fire in your belly and stood up to change fate.
Select the country you wrote to:
Click Submit only after you’ve mailed it.
Are you certain you\'ve stamped and mailed it?
Congratulations! You\’re one of us now. A Fatechanger
Which environmental policy do you feel\nyouth should try to get passed?
Are you sure you want to vote for this policy?
Are you sure this is your location? This is important.
Always keep your planned and collected signatures updated below.
I\'m sorry, but the goverment of your location doesn\'t offer the opportunity for citizen ballon initiatives. But you can influence them with letters in our letter-writing campaign.
Your location is currently not live, but you can already fill out your planned signatures below.

When a campaign goes live, this is where you can track it: the location, deadline, how many signatures we have and need, and how many you collected.\n\nWe’ll let you know what’s happening with notifications. But if we’re going to change the laws, we’re really going to need a lot of kids, so spread the app like a wild fire.
Watch the video about the ballot process to understand how it works.
Vote on which policy you want passed.
After kids decide, you’ll be notified. Check out the policy, then enter in the app how many signatures you plan to collect.
Download and print the signature collection paper. Begin collecting. Share.
As you collect signatures, keep them updated - see how many we need.
We can’t do this alone; we must recruit other organizations to help - kids will lead, adults will follow. Tell your local newspaper, environmenal groups, your friends!
You’ll be notified when and where to mail your signature papers.
Collecting signatures yourself is brilliant. But let’s do a little math.
Now, say you get your girl scout troop or surf buddies or class to collect them too.
And ask them to multiply their impact…
